intro: Diplotaxis erucoides subsp. erucoides, commonly known as the African cabbages or yellow cabbages, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of thick, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
